p: Pterocarpus marsupium ( P. marsupium) is a large, high tree that can grow up from 15 to 30 m tall ( Figure 9). It belongs to the Fabaceae family and distributes in India, Nepal, and Sri Lanka, which is widely used in ‘Ayurveda’ as ‘Rasayana’ for the management of various metabolic disorders including hyperglycemia [ 92].
